project.teaser: BatteReverse aims to enable the next generation of battery reverse logistics (RL). It will develop a more efficient and universal method for battery discharge and first diagnosis for a wide range of Li-ion battery types, safety packaging with a monitoring system reducing...
project.objective: BatteReverse aims to enable the next generation of battery reverse logistics (RL). It will develop a more efficient and universal method for battery discharge and first diagnosis for a wide range of Li-ion battery types, safety packaging with a monitoring system reducing thermal runaway risk during transportation of batteries, automated dismantling and sorting of battery components based on a safe and more efficient human-robot collaboration, and a more precise and faster Remaining Useful Life assessment of battery modules for 2nd life applications based on acoustic testing and machine learning algorithms. On top of that, BatteReverse will develop a Battery Data Space with standardised labelling and battery passport functionalities to improve battery identification. We will connect the stakeholders through a community platform and analyse the entire RL process by a digital twin (DT) simulation that will optimise profitability of RL circular business models. The innovations will be integrated and demonstrated in an operational environment in two use-cases for end-of-first-life (EoFL) EV batteries - recycling and repurposing – mirrored with the DT simulation. By 2026 we expect these developments to contribute to following outcomes: increase recycling efficiency by 5%, raise share of repurposed EoFL batteries to 10%, reduce risk of severe events in reverse logistics to 1/10.000, successfully simulate two successful RL business models and to have a stakeholder’s community platform with 50+ stakeholders. These outcomes will contribute to the sovereignty of the EU in the battery sector. By further uptake of the developed results beyond the project, BatteReverse targets to avoid the use of 3.691 tonnes/year of primary critical raw materials, on top of that avoid the deployment of 100,8 MWh capacity of new batteries yearly while capturing an extra €30,24 million/year value out of EoFL batteries and avoiding 31 severe risk events/year within the EU RL battery chain by 2029.
project.title: A next-generation automated, connected, and standardised process for increased safety, efficiency, and sustainability of Li-ion BATTEry REVERSE logistics
project.keywords: reverse logistics, EV batteries, repurposing, recycling, battery passport, automatisation, digital twin, RUL assessment

Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: Data Management Plan is defined during the first 3 months of the project. This deliverable will introduce the methodology followed in the project to manage the data (reference definition, storage process, ...)

details.authors: Kaarlela, Tero; Villagrossi, Enrico; Rastegarpanah, Alireza; San-Miguel-Tello, Alberto; Pitkäaho, Tomi

result.title: Report with circular battery use cases
result.description: Report presenting a variety of use cases where battery reverse logistics has been employed either on commercial or pilot scale. The use cases description will include information such as: stakeholders involved, types of circularity practices, economical and technical feasibility, identified barriers and most relevant features/parameters that need to be optimised.

result.title: Quality Management Plan
result.description: Tools for project management (governance,frequency of the meetings, Gannt chart, workbreakdown structure, deliverables process, templates...) and progress follow-up.

result.title: BatteReverse Community platform
result.description: Website that will be the source of information about the project, its members and public deliverables, as well as an online space where stakeholders of the reverse logistics process (researchers, industrial practitioners, and policy makers) can join as members and exchange best practices. The website will be regularly updated and at a later stage of the project will be connected with the Battery Data Space (D2.5).

result.title: Map of key stakeholders
result.description: "Identification key industrial and policy-related stakeholders involved, or having an impact on the reverse logisitcs process. Information such as location, size and scope of activities will be presented in a visual way on the project website (D7.2). This will support the creation of the ""AS-IS"" model (D1.4)."

result.title: BatteReverse visual identity kit
result.description: This deliverable provides the project corporate visual identity manual. Including logotype, fonts, graphic resources and templates that will be use throught the life spam of the project.

result.title: Communication, Dissemination & Exploitation plan
result.description: The CDE plan defines the strategy for communication, dissemination and exploitation activities of the project. The plan includes messages, communication channels, tools, and target audiences for outreach and succesful uptake of the project results.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
